def_cn: (用在疑问句中，与I和we连用表示提出或征求意见)
def_en: You use shall with 'I' and 'we' in questions in order to make offers or suggestions, or to ask for advice.

def_cn: (通常与 I 和 we 连用)将要，将会
def_en: You use shall, usually with 'I' and 'we', when you are referring to something that you intend to do, or when you are referring to something that you are sure will happen to you in the future.

def_cn: (与I和we连用，在演讲或文章中用于引出将要讨论或解释的内容)后面要，下文会
def_en: You use shall with 'I' or 'we' during a speech or piece of writing to say what you are going to discuss or explain later.

def_cn: (通常指按照规则或法律规定)必须，一定，将
def_en: You use shall to indicate that something must happen, usually because of a rule or law. You use shall not to indicate that something must not happen.

def_cn: (通常与 you 连用)可以，能够
def_en: You use shall, usually with 'you', when you are telling someone that they will be able to do or have something they want.

def_cn: (用于 look forward to 和 hope 之类的动词前表示语气的委婉)
def_en: You use shall with verbs such as 'look forward to' and 'hope' to say politely that you are looking forward to something or hoping to do something.

def_cn: (表示可能的结果或后果)应该，就会
def_en: You use shall when you are referring to the likely result or consequence of a particular action or situation.
shall I say→see: say;
